answers: fecal microbiota transplants [or FMT; accept feces or stool or synonyms; accept Bristol stool scale; accept stool bank]
C. diff [or Clostridioides difficile; accept Clostridium difficile or Peptoclostridium difficile; prompt on Clostridioides or Clostridium or Peptoclostridium]
parts: Identify this emerging type of treatment for Crohn's disease. The nonprofit OpenBiome banks this treatment's human-derived samples, which can be classified on the Bristol scale.

One promising use of fecal transplants is treating infections of this spore-forming bacterium, which can cause diarrhea and colitis. Infections with this Firmicutes species are often nosocomial ("no-zo-KO-mee-ul").
C. diff infection may occur after antibiotic use compromises this general phenomenon. This two-word concept describes how the endogenous microbiota prevents invasion by intestinal pathogens.

answers: BNP Paribas S.A. [or BNP Paribas S.A.; Banque Nationale de Paris]
parts: Identify these economic weapons frequently employed by the US government to target hostile regimes.
This bank, the largest in France, was fined 9 billion dollars for violating secondary sanctions in 2014.

Zimbabwe, which declared a national holiday in October 2019 to protest American sanctions, hired this lobbyist to get them off the sanctions shit-list. This member of the Harvey Weinstein defense team wrote the book Reasonable Doubts about his experience in the OJ Simpson case.

answers: grizzly bears [or North American brown bears; or Ursus arctos horribilis; accept Grizzly Man; prompt on brown bears or Ursidae]
parts: Identify this state whose Challis National Forest makes up part of its large River of No Return protected wilderness area.
In May 2019, Steve Bullock, then the Democratic governor of this "Big Sky" state, signed into law a bill that ended its practice of allowing conservation licenses for state-owned land.
Environmentalists tried to bid for hunting licenses for these creatures in Wyoming to film them rather than shoot them. One of these animals titles a documentary about Timothy Treadwell.

answers: Italy [or Italia; or Italian Republic or Repubblica Italiana] (The comedian was Beppe Grillo of the Five Star Movement.)
Marseille [or Marseilles; accept Wicked City: The Many Cultures of Marseille]
parts: It's not the UKIP, but this platform party founded by Nigel Farage cynically won 28 seats in the European Parliament despite campaigning for Britain's eponymous withdrawal from the EU.

Gerbaudo looks at the rise of a digital party in this country backed by the techno-utopian founder of Webegg. A comedian and future politician from this country organized an anti-elite "Vaffa Day" in 2007.

Gerbaudo's book profiles Jean-Luc Mélenchon ("may-lon-SHON"), who now represents this city in the National Assembly. Nicholas Hewitt's recent book on this "Wicked City" describes how its long-time mayor Gaston Defferre terrorized the Pieds-Noirs.

answers: vehicles [or vehicular homelessness; accept specific vehicles such as cars or vans or RVs or recreational vehicles or trailers; accept safe parking program]
Saint Paul, Minnesota [prompt on the Twin Cities]
parts: Identify these unconventional residences where over 10,000 LA residents live as part of an official "safe" program for them. People often prioritize buying these things over paying for houses and apartments because they’re often necessary to get to their jobs.

This neighborhood in the larger LA metro area, which was once known as the “slum by the sea,” cracked down on living in cars in the early 2010s. Its famous skatepark was recreated in the recent Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater remake.

This state capital waived towing and storage fees to make life easier for people living in vehicles during the COVID-19 pandemic. Its MLS team plays in Allianz Field, one of four stadiums in the same metro area designed by the firm Populous.
